results.title: Color (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”.
Illustrates color in nature - in pigments, yarn, clay, wood, and other art materials in order to stimulate interest in experimentation and encourage children to put colors together in their own way.

group_works.title: Community theatre
group_works.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert and British Broadcasting Corporation

results.title: Community theatre
results.creator_credit: John Selwyn Gilbert and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art and Environment”.
The term “community theatre” covers a wide spectrum of groups which reject the normal relationship between audience and actors. They act in factories, schools, at meetings, in the street, performing for people who normally would not go to the theatre.

results.title: Around the world in 80 days
results.creator_credit: Roger Mills, Clem Vallance and BBC
results.brief_description: Complete with visas, running shoes, an inflatable globe and sound advice from Alan Whicker, Michael Palin set off to circumnavigate the world using only forms of transport available to the fictional Phileas Fogg. His Passepartout was a 5-strong film crew, his journey was phenomenal, his deadline was 80 days. -

results.title: Homeward bound
results.creator_credit: Clem Vallance, Roger Mills, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Around the world in 80 days”.
Homeward bound covers days 28 to 79 of Michael Palin’s (ex- Monty Python) 20th Century attempt to replicate the round-the-world trip of the fictional Phineas Fogg. The video takes us with Michael from Madras to Singapore via a Yugoslav freighter on which Palin works as a deckhand; from Singapore to Hong Kong and Shanghai, where Palin samples snake; from Shanghai to California via the eerie uninhabited world of a giant container ship and then by train, dog sled, balloon and ship on the last leg back to London.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Clem Vallance, Roger Mills, Arts and Entertainment Network and BBC-TV

results.title: Outward bound
results.creator_credit: Roger Mills, Clem Vallance and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Around the world in 80 days”.
In this the first half of his journey, Michael Palin travels from London to Madras, via Venice, Alexandria, Saudi Arabia, Dubai and Bombay. Dropping further and further behind schedule Palin struggles with missed connections, bureaucratic negotiations and seasickness until, after a quick shave by a blind man with a cut-throat blade, he boards the train to Madras, only to find his seat has been given to three different Michael Palins, one of them a woman!

results.title: Arkady Leokum's Tell Me Why
results.brief_description: Based on the best selling book series by Arkady Leokum this series of videos answers questions that children commonly ask on a wide variety of subjects. Colourful graphics and exciting film footage combined with quick search numbers on screen make this an easy to use and fun learning tool.

group_works.title: Life forms, animals and animal oddities

results.title: Mesas and gibber plains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of some Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions, and discusses the formation of mesas and gibber plains. Animated diagrams illustrate formations. The importance of water erosion in arid regions is stressed.

results.title: Devil's Marbles and the Olgas
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
The film provides a geological background to residuals in an arid landscape. It shows the influence of jointing and physical and chemical weathering on rocks. Particularly stressed are spheroidal weathering, freeze-thaw, coalescing alluvial fans and the influence of vegetation on rocks.

results.title: Ayers Rock
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Arid Landforms”.
Gives examples of Australian landforms resulting from weathering and erosion in arid regions. Illustrates examples of weathering and erosion responsible for producing the features seen in Ayers Rock. Shows three types of residuals found in arid Central Australia, kinds of weathering responsible for the formation of Ayers Rock and emphasises geological time periods. Also notes in detail the caves, grooves and guttering, and the under-cut base caused by running water. Suitable for upper secondary level.
